lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/bytebuddy.bytebuddy.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run bytebuddy.bytebuddy.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Handles reading and writing tasks to the disk.
* Responsible for loading and saving the task list.
* @return ArrayList of tasks loaded from file
* @throws IOException If the file cannot be read
* Saves the given {@link TaskList} to disk.
* Each task will be converted into a string representation
* and written line by line into the save file.
* Converts raw task data from the save file into a {@link Task} object.
* @param parts The split string data representing a task
* @throws RuntimeException If the data format is invalid or corrupted
return new Event(parts[2], from, to, isDone);
* Represents a task with a deadline in ByteBuddy.
* A  Deadline has a description, a completion status,
* and a due date by which it must be completed.
* Creates a Deadline with the given description and due date string.
* @param by Due date in the format 'yyyy-MM-dd'.
* @param isDone true if the task is already completed; false otherwise.
public Deadline(String description, String by, boolean isDone) {
* Creates a Deadline with the given description and due date.
* @param by Due date as a LocalDate.
* @param isDone true if the task is already completed; false otherwise.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDate by, boolean isDone) {
* Appends the deadline date formatted as 'MMM d yyyy'.
* Represents an event task in ByteBuddy.
* An Event has a description, a start date/time, an end date/time, and a completion status.
* Creates an Event with the given description and start/end times.
* @param from Start date/time in the format 'yyyy-MM-dd HHmm'.
* @param to End date/time in the format 'yyyy-MM-dd HHmm'.
* @param isDone true if the event is already completed; false otherwise.
public Event(String description, String from, String to, boolean isDone) {
* Creates an Event with the given description and start/end times.
* @param from Start date/time as a LocalDateTime.
* @param to End date/time as a LocalDateTime.
* @param isDone true if the event is already completed; false otherwise.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to, boolean isDone) {
* Creates an Event that is not yet completed.
* @param from Start date/time in the format 'yyyy-MM-dd HHmm'.
* @param to End date/time in the format 'yyyy-MM-dd HHmm'.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* Represents a generic task in ByteBuddy.
* A task stores a description, its completion status,
* Subclasses such as {@link Todo}, {@link Deadline}, and {@link Event}
* extend this class to add additional fields.
* Creates a new task with an explicit completion status.
* @param description The description of the task
* @param taskType    The type of the task
* @param isDone      Whether the task is already marked as done
public Task(String description, TaskType taskType, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a string representation of the task's completion status.
* @return "1" if the task is done, otherwise "0"
return (isDone ? "1" : "0"); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the string representation of the task,
* Represents a collection of tasks in ByteBuddy.
* Provides methods to add, remove, retrieve, and update tasks.
* Implements {@link Iterable} so tasks can be traversed using enhanced for-loops.
* Creates a task list initialized with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize with.
* Marks the task at the given index as completed.
* @param index Index of the task to mark (0-based).
* Marks the task at the given index as not completed.
* @param index Index of the task to unmark (0-based).
* Retrieves the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to retrieve (0-based).
* @return The task at the given index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Adds a new task to the list.
* Removes the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to remove (0-based).
* Returns an iterator over the tasks in this list.
* Represents a to-do task in ByteBuddy.
* A To-do has only a description and a completion status.
* Creates a new to-do task that is not yet completed.
* @param description Description of the to-do task.
* Creates a new to-do task with a specified completion status.
* @param description Description of the to-do task.
* @param isDone true if the to-do is already completed; false otherwise.
* Handles user interactions for the ByteBuddy application.
* Provides methods for reading commands, printing messages,
* Creates a new {@code Ui} instance with a {@link Scanner}
* to read input from standard input.
* Reads the next line of user input and trims leading/trailing whitespace.
* @return the user input as a string.
* Prints a greeting message when the program starts.
printLineMsg("Hello! I'm bytebuddy.ByteBuddy\n" + "What can I do for you?");
* Prints a farewell message when the program ends
printLineMsg("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays an error message indicating that the saved
* tasks file could not be loaded.
* Prints a custom error message between divider lines
* @param msg the error message to display.
* Prints all tasks in the given {@link TaskList}.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to display.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");

public void printMarked(Task t, boolean marked) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
